articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: How to Communicate Better With Your Children in the New Year
articles.description: Be a sportscaster. Make a glitter jar. Get a pet. Whether or not you rely on strategies like these, the central advice is to listen more.
articles.content:
Often, the central message in experts advice to parents is find ways to pay attention to what is going on in your kids lives, to be present with them and to listen.
By Lisa Damour
The counselor was holding a clear jam jar. Its lid was glued on and it was fi… [+1344 chars]

articles.author: Elisabeth Egan
articles.title: Sex Sells. It’s True Now and It Was True 100 Years Ago.
articles.description: In 1920, a publisher told The Times, “It is my firm conviction that any book that deals sincerely with real life, that is a first-rate book, is bound to succeed.”
articles.content: BLAST FROM THE PAST We dont have a crystal ball so we cant look into the future to see what will be on the best-seller list in 2020. What we do have at the Book Review is the ability to look back either in our library of bound issues dating back to 1930 or in… [+1982 chars]

articles.author: Jamie Tarabay
articles.title: Christmas Typhoon Batters Central Philippines
articles.description: Thousands traveling home for the holiday were stranded as flights and ferries were canceled. At least 16 deaths were reported.
articles.content:
Typhoon Phanfone ravaged three provinces in the central Philippines over the Christmas holiday, with at least 16 people reported to have been killed.
The typhoon made landfall on Tuesday at 4:45 p.m. over Salcedo in Eastern Samar Province, according to Pagas… [+688 chars]

articles.author: Andy Newman
articles.title: Fighting to Survive on a 5-Cent Deposit
articles.description: Canners and trucks converge in a shadow economy of the streets.
articles.content:
While only a fraction of canners sell to the trucks, within that world there are a dizzying variety of enterprises. 
There are canners who sell their cans to bigger canners who sell to the trucks. Others buy their friends empties for 3 cents each and sell th… [+1606 chars]

articles.author: Noam Scheiber and Neal E. Boudette
articles.title: Behind a U.A.W. Crisis: Lavish Meals and Luxury Villas
articles.description: A federal investigation has led to accusations that union leaders diverted funds to perks like a $6,500 steak dinner and golf outings and gear costing $80,000.
articles.content: Elizabeth Bunn, who served as the U.A.W.s second-ranking officer from 2002 to 2010, said that under Mr. Wells, Palm Springs was known as a place where officials could enjoy themselves at union expense for well beyond the length of a conference, though the beh… [+2145 chars]

articles.author: Juliet Macur
articles.title: The Whistle-Blowers Next Door
articles.description: Yuliya Stepanova and her husband, Vitaly, fled Russia with their son and a secret. Now they live a quiet life in America while the doping scandal they disclosed rages on.
articles.content:
She told me, I just want to let you know that we are on your side, Yuliya recalled. But when she told Vitaly about the conversation, he snapped, I told you not to talk to strangers.
Yet at times, she has been very vocal about the need forclean sports, testif… [+1997 chars]
